Text:
When the day of her outing with Cid arrives, Princess
Iris Midgar makes her appearance at the spot where
they had decided to meet.
What?!

Good morning, Cid. How fortunate it is that we have
been blessed with such nice weather.
B-But...Princess Iris...!

Is something the matter? Why are you so stiff?
You needn't be nervous.

N-No, I'm not nervous...it's just, um, the way
you're dressed today...!
The way I'm dressed? But I haven't changed anything.
Argh! Why...
Huh?

Iris simply stares in response to his question. Cid
looks uncomfortable, but after a few seconds, he
stares up at the sky and sighs deeply.

I humbly apologize—I am well aware of how rude this
is going to sound—but Princess...do you have any idea
just how you're being perceived right now?
Um...what do you mean?

Princess Iris Midgar is a celebrity. All the
commoners know what you look like.
W-Well, yes. Of course they do.

I've heard that among royalty, you're quite
popular...rather, you're idolized.
Thank you for the compliment.

Um...it's not a compliment... I'm trying to say that
everyone is staring at you!
Oh?!

It is then that Iris finally notices that there is
nobody standing anywhere near them.

Upon a second glance, she notices that most of the
people in the marketplace have formed a large circle
at a distance from Iris and Cid...and they are staring.
Hey, ain't that Princess Iris?

What is she doing in a place like this... Oh, no, is
somebody in trouble?!
Cid...what should we do?!
Well, for a start, can we get away from here?
Yes... Yes, that's a good idea.

And with the crowd murmuring behind them, the two
move over to a street lined with stores.

(I originally came here with the intention of
learning more about how commoners live,
but walking here now, everything feels
so new to me.)

(I'm glad I insisted that Cid join me. Having his
presence beside me is reassuring.)
Perhaps that is what Alexia likes about you...
D-Did you say something?!
No...I just wished to thank you again, Cid.

Agh! P-Please don't! Do you have any idea how people
will perceive me if they see a princess bowing to me?!

We have merchandise from other lands, sold nowhere
else! We've got great bargains here!
Imported goods...may we stop and have a look?

Welcome to my sto—ohhh?! Ah...Ahhh Princess Iris?! 
I-Is it really you?!
Yes, I am Iris Midgar.

Eek! M-My shop is all above board! I'm n-n-n-not
engaging in any s-smuggling, I swear!

Whoa! His character settings are glitching. Guess it
was inevitable...

Smuggling? I never said anything about suspecting you
for smuggling...
My books are in order and I pay my taxes, too!
Ah— All right...
I'm not doing anything shady!
C-Cid...
Let's go to the next shop.
Good idea.

With the thoroughly terrified shop owner well behind
them, Iris and Cid make their way to the next shop...
However—
Wha?! Princess Iris?!

Yes. I see you are selling finely-crafted woodworks. 
Did you make them yourself?
Um...
He was so nervous, he fainted. Let's move on.
He was nervous?!

(I made someone so nervous that he fainted? Next
time, I'd better approach the shop keeper with a
friendly smile!)
I smell something sweet... Cid, what is this shop?

They sell this pastry—it's crispy on the outside and
soft on the inside. Everyone says it's really good.
Want to try it?
Yes...but first, we must test it for poison.
Poison?!

Ahhh! Nooo! Forget she said that! Y'know, she meant,
make sure she's not allergic to it!

O-Ohhh! W-Well, yes, our shop sells only one hundred
percent organic products!

Um, I think it should be okay. But if you're worried
about it, we can always take a rain check.

No, I will be fine. May I have two, please? One for
me and one for him.
Y-Yes, of course!
Well, let me pay—

N-No! I could never accept payment from Princess
Iris, protector of the capital!
Huh?! But I—

If I accept payment from you, my boss will be furious
with me! Please! Take as many as you wish, Princess!
C-Cid...how should we...

You can take your pastry, Princess...and you can pay
for mine. I guess that's our only choice.
Oh! Good idea!
That was delicious. Well...I deserve perks like this!
Um, C-Cid?! Do you, um...er, walk while eating?!

Oh! Right...would you like to find a place to sit
down?

Do you do this sort of thing with Alexia? Does she
really eat while walking?
Well, when in Rome, as the saying goes.

I see... Well, if that's what she does...then I'm
doing it, too!

I don't think that statement deserved all that
melodrama...

But I am here today to experience what Alexia has
experienced. I must be able to do this...!

Iris stares down solemnly at her pastry. Her eyes,
brimming with determination, makes the commoners
in her vicinity hold their breaths in wonder...
Arrrgh! Jeeeez!
Princess, you're standing out!
Huh?

If you glare at your pastry like it killed your
parents, everyone'll think you had a fight
with that poor baker!

B-But I wasn't glaring. I was trying to decide where
I should bite it to prevent it from crumbling apart.
I was wondering if I really could eat it cleanly
while walking!

Mmmrrrggg...if that's what you're trying to do, then
act more natural!

I wish I had a saucer and a fork...but I suppose
those things would be out of place in an open-
air market?

If you brought a saucer and a fork to the market,
you'd only draw even more attention! You'd be
like an ultra-hyper alien girl!

Um, when you were here with Alexia...did she draw
attention to herself?

Maybe a little on the first day, but by the third day,
she was blending right in with the crowd. And she
definitely did not bring her own saucer and fork.

W-Well, if that is how she did things! Then I, too,
shall rise to the challenge! There's nothing Alexia
can do that I can't.

Urrrg...rising to the challenge is nice and all...but 
the fact of the matter is, you've kind of already
drawn lots of attention to yourself!

There's way too many people by the street vendors! 
Let's go someplace where the crowds are smaller!

Yes...it pains me to admit it, but I suppose walking
among the street vendors was too difficult a task
for me at present.

(Oh dear! I've caused a younger person—and my
sister's friend, at that—so much trouble on my
behalf!)

(I may think I'm acting perfectly natural, but from
Cid's perspective, I look terribly out of place...)

(All my childhood, I spent my days learning the sword
and how to be a proper princess...)

(And while those days were incredibly important to
me...I had no idea that the world I've been living in
was so small. That much has become painfully clear
to me...!)
